moves.1. e4: Evans Gambit. This is a tricky opening to play  - I've had mixed success. It's an aggressive opening  - white needs to establish a mating attack or win pieces before the endgame. Black's challenge is to try to get to the endgame with a pawn advantage.
moves.4... Bxb4 5. c3 Ba5 6. d4 exd4 7. O-O Bb: This may not have been the best move - perhaps Nf6 is better?
moves.16... Qc5+: this doesn't really help black - perhaps castling or Nb3 would be better
moves.18... exf4 19. Qxf4 Qd6 20. Qh4: Can't afford to swap Qs - need to stay attacking. This moves sets up an interesting exchange on f6 later
moves.20... Ne5 21. Be2: again - don't want to swap pieces - need to stay attacking
moves.21... Bd7 22. Bh5+: this starts the real trouble for black. g6 creates problems, Nf7 is also trouble - so perhaps black did the best thing by moving the K
moves.22... Kd8: I can now see an interesting move - Rxf6. Just need to move the black Q away.
moves.23. Ba3 Qa6 24. d6: ....or block the Q from defending f6
moves.24... cxd6: I can't make the move yet - the K would escape to c7
moves.25. Rac1 Rc8 26. Rcd1 Qxa4: ?? this pawn swap is trouble for black
moves.27. Bxd6 Nc6 28. Rxf6: and finally I can make the play - hard to see how black defends this now
